info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 3:15PM EDT until August 07 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Madison County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Mitchell County in western North Carolina... North central Haywood County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Buncombe County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Yancey County in western North Carolina... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 315 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Greeneville to 14 miles north of Waynesville, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Marshall, Weaverville, Mars Hill, Hot Springs, Ramseytown, Fines Creek, Swiss, Flat Creek, Max Patch and Faust. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for western North Carolina. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
